intro: Oldenlandia wulsinii, commonly known as the goldenstar mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and wetlands. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
